caption: This photograph features a vast marshland or wetland area, dominated by tall golden-brown reeds that sway slightly under the influence of a breeze. The foreground is filled with these dense reeds, with patches of visible water reflecting a clear sky. The scene transitions seamlessly into the background, where a more distant landscape presents a slightly raised, darkened landfill area embellished with various materials and debris. Notably, two distinct utility poles are positioned in the mid-distance, suggesting the presence of human infrastructure nearby. The sky above is devoid of clouds and displays a soft gradient of light, suggesting either early morning or late afternoon light. The overall composition invokes a serene yet somber mood, emphasizing the interaction between natural landscapes and human encroachment.
title: Looking across the salt marsh to the Middletown dump
